briefdescription.para: The type of the 2D triangulation data structure describing the reconstructed surface, being a model of TriangulationDataStructure_2.

listitem.para: The type Triangulation_data_structure_2::Vertex is model of the concept TriangulationDataStructure_2::Vertex and has additionally the method vertex_3() that returns a Vertex_handle to the associated 3D vertex.

The type Triangulation_data_structure_2::Face is model of the concept TriangulationDataStructure_2::Face and has additionally the method facet() that returns the associated Facet, and a method bool is_on_surface() for testing if a face is part of the reconstructed surface or a face incident to a boundary edge.

detaileddescription.para: In case the surface has boundaries, the 2D surface has one vertex which is associated to the infinite vertex of the 3D triangulation.

briefdescription.para: The type of the 3D Delaunay triangulation (the first template parameter).
The type of the facet priority functor (the second template parameter).
The number type.
The point type.
The vertex handle type of the 3D triangulation.
The cell handle type of the 3D triangulation.
The facet type of the 3D triangulation.
A bidirectional iterator range which enables to enumerate all points that were removed from the 3D Delaunay triangulation during the surface reconstruction.

detaileddescription.para: The value type of the iterator is Point.

briefdescription.para: A bidirectional iterator range which enables to visit all vertices on a boundary.

detaileddescription.para: The value type of the iterator is Vertex_handle.

briefdescription.para: A bidirectional iterator range which enables to visit all boundaries.

detaileddescription.para: The value type of the iterator is Vertex_on_boundary_range.

briefdescription.para: Constructor for the unstructured point cloud given as 3D Delaunay triangulation.
runs the surface reconstruction function.

parameterdescription.para: candidates incident to surface triangles which are not in the beta-wedge are discarded, if the ratio of their radius and the radius of the surface triangle is larger than radius_ratio_bound. Described in Section Dealing with Multiple Components, Boundaries and Sharp Edges.
half the angle of the wedge in which only the radius of triangles counts for the plausibility of candidates. Described in Section Plausibility of a Candidate Triangle.

briefdescription.para: returns the reconstructed surface.
returns the underlying 3D Delaunay triangulation.
returns an iterator range over the outliers.
returns an iterator range over the boundaries.
returns true if the reconstructed surface has boundaries.
returns true if the facet is on the surface.
returns true if the facet f2 is on the surface.
returns true if the vertex v2 is on the surface.
computes the priority of the facet (c,index) such that the facet with the smallest radius of Delaunay sphere has the highest priority.

parameterdescription.para: handle to the cell containing the facet
index of the facet in c

briefdescription.para: returns the infinite floating value that prevents a facet to be used.

briefdescription.para: The class Advancing_front_surface_reconstruction enables advanced users to provide the unstructured point cloud in a 3D Delaunay triangulation.

detaileddescription.para: The reconstruction algorithm then marks vertices and faces in the triangulation as being on the 2D surface embedded in 3D space, and constructs a 2D triangulation data structure that describes the surface. The vertices and facets of the 2D triangulation data structure store handles to the vertices and faces of the 3D triangulation, which enables the user to explore the 2D as well as 3D neighborhood of vertices and facets of the surface.

parameterdescription.para: must be a Delaunay_triangulation_3 whose Traits template parameter must be a model of AdvancingFrontSurfaceReconstructionTraits_3 and whose Tds template parameter must be a model of TriangulationDataStructure_3 with Advancing_front_surface_reconstruction_vertex_base_3 and Advancing_front_surface_reconstruction_cell_base_3 blended into the vertex and cell type, respectively. The default value is: CGAL::Delaunay_triangulation_3<CGAL::Exact_predicates_inexact_constructions_kernel, CGAL::Triangulation_data_structure_3< CGAL::Advancing_front_surface_reconstruction_vertex_base_3< CGAL::Exact_predicates_inexact_constructions_kernel>, CGAL::Advancing_front_surface_reconstruction_cell_base_3< CGAL::Exact_predicates_inexact_constructions_kernel>>>

must be a functor offering FToperator()(Advancing_front_surface_reconstruction::Cell_handle,int) returning the priority of the facet (Cell_handle,int). This functor enables the user to choose how candidate triangles are prioritized. If a facet should not appear in the output, infinity() must be returned. It defaults to a functor that returns the smallest_radius_delaunay_sphere().
